answer:
<p>You should use '<a href="https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/functions.html#zip" rel="noreferrer">zip</a>' function. Here is an example how your own zip function can look like</p>

<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">custom_zip</span>(<span class="hljs-params">seq1, seq2</span>):
    it1 = <span class="hljs-built_in">iter</span>(seq1)
    it2 = <span class="hljs-built_in">iter</span>(seq2)
    <span class="hljs-keyword">while</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>:
        <span class="hljs-keyword">yield</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">next</span>(it1), <span class="hljs-built_in">next</span>(it2)
</code></pre>

<p>You can bundle the nth elements into a tuple or list using comprehension, then pass them out with a generator function.</p>

<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">iterate_multi</span>(<span class="hljs-params">*lists</span>):
    <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> i <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">range</span>(<span class="hljs-built_in">min</span>(<span class="hljs-built_in">map</span>(<span class="hljs-built_in">len</span>,lists))):
        <span class="hljs-keyword">yield</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">tuple</span>(l[i] <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> l <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> lists)

<span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> l1, l2, l3 <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> iterate_multi([<span class="hljs-number">1</span>,<span class="hljs-number">2</span>,<span class="hljs-number">3</span>],[<span class="hljs-number">4</span>,<span class="hljs-number">5</span>,<span class="hljs-number">6</span>],[<span class="hljs-number">7</span>,<span class="hljs-number">8</span>,<span class="hljs-number">9</span>]):
    <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-built_in">str</span>(l1)+<span class="hljs-string">","</span>+<span class="hljs-built_in">str</span>(l2)+<span class="hljs-string">","</span>+<span class="hljs-built_in">str</span>(l3))
</code></pre>
